# Scrum Master Checklist

This checklist helps the Scrum Master facilitate sprint activities, remove blockers, and drive continuous improvement for the team.

---

## Sprint Start Activities

- [ ] **Sprint Planning Preparation**
  - [ ] Confirm backlog is prioritized and refined with Product Owner
  - [ ] Ensure user stories have clear acceptance criteria
  - [ ] Review team capacity and availability for the sprint
  - [ ] Prepare meeting agenda and materials

- [ ] **Sprint Planning Meeting**
  - [ ] Facilitate sprint goal definition with Product Owner and team
  - [ ] Guide team in selecting backlog items for the sprint
  - [ ] Ensure team understands each story and acceptance criteria
  - [ ] Help team estimate work and commit to achievable sprint scope
  - [ ] Document sprint goal and committed items

- [ ] **Sprint Setup**
  - [ ] Update sprint board/project tracker with committed items
  - [ ] Schedule daily standups and sprint ceremonies
  - [ ] Communicate sprint goal and key dates to stakeholders

---

## Daily Standup Facilitation

- [ ] **Before Standup**
  - [ ] Review sprint board for progress and potential blockers
  - [ ] Note any missing updates or stale items

- [ ] **During Standup**
  - [ ] Keep meeting to 15 minutes or less
  - [ ] Ensure each team member shares: progress, plan, blockers
  - [ ] Note blockers and follow-up items
  - [ ] Keep discussion focused; parking lot deeper conversations
  - [ ] Update sprint board in real-time if helpful

- [ ] **After Standup**
  - [ ] Address or escalate blockers immediately
  - [ ] Follow up on action items from previous standups
  - [ ] Update stakeholders on critical blockers or risks

---

## Blocker Removal Steps

- [ ] **Identify Blocker**: Clearly define the blocker and its impact
- [ ] **Assess Urgency**: Determine severity and impact on sprint goal
- [ ] **Team-Level Resolution**: Facilitate team discussion to resolve if possible
- [ ] **Cross-Team Coordination**: Reach out to other teams for dependencies
- [ ] **Escalation**: Escalate to PM, Product Owner, or leadership if unresolved
- [ ] **Track Progress**: Monitor blocker until resolved and communicate updates
- [ ] **Document**: Log blocker and resolution for retrospective discussion

---

## Sprint Review / Demo Facilitation

- [ ] **Preparation**
  - [ ] Coordinate with team to identify completed items for demo
  - [ ] Prepare demo environment and test flows
  - [ ] Send invites to stakeholders and product team
  - [ ] Create demo agenda with team

- [ ] **During Review**
  - [ ] Present sprint goal and what was committed vs. completed
  - [ ] Facilitate demo of completed features by team members
  - [ ] Collect stakeholder feedback and questions
  - [ ] Document feedback and action items
  - [ ] Review sprint metrics (velocity, burndown)

- [ ] **After Review**
  - [ ] Share demo recording or summary with absent stakeholders
  - [ ] Create tickets for feedback items requiring follow-up

---

## Sprint Retrospective Facilitation

- [ ] **Preparation**
  - [ ] Choose retrospective format/activity (e.g., Start/Stop/Continue, Mad/Sad/Glad)
  - [ ] Review sprint data: velocity, blockers, incidents
  - [ ] Set up anonymous feedback collection if needed

- [ ] **During Retrospective**
  - [ ] Set the stage: remind team of psychological safety and purpose
  - [ ] Gather data: what went well, what didn't, what to improve
  - [ ] Generate insights: identify root causes and patterns
  - [ ] Decide on action items: 2-3 concrete improvements for next sprint
  - [ ] Assign owners and timelines for action items
  - [ ] Close retrospective on positive note

- [ ] **After Retrospective**
  - [ ] Document retrospective notes and action items
  - [ ] Add improvement action items to next sprint backlog
  - [ ] Follow up on action items from previous retrospectives

---

## Improvement Tracking

- [ ] **Track Metrics**: Monitor velocity, cycle time, blocker resolution time
- [ ] **Action Item Follow-Up**: Ensure retrospective action items are completed
- [ ] **Process Adjustments**: Update team processes based on learnings
- [ ] **Celebrate Wins**: Recognize team achievements and improvements
- [ ] **Share Learnings**: Communicate process improvements to other teams when relevant

---

## Continuous Responsibilities

- [ ] **Coach Team**: Guide team on Scrum practices and self-organization
- [ ] **Protect Team**: Shield team from external interruptions during sprint
- [ ] **Facilitate Collaboration**: Encourage cross-functional collaboration and knowledge sharing
- [ ] **Process Improvement**: Continuously identify and implement process enhancements
- [ ] **Stakeholder Communication**: Keep stakeholders informed of team progress and impediments
